item.title: Best Saber Light Cones in Honkai: Star Rail
item.description:
Saber is a hypercarry who needs a lot of things to work optimally in Honkai: Star Rail . Even if you have the best team for her, you likely won't be able to get as much damage out of her skills if you aren't using the right Light Cones.

Thankfully, Saber is a fairly straightforward character as far as buildcrafting goes. She scales off ATK and CRIT stats, which means she'll be able to make good use of most of the Light Cone options for Destruction characters in Star Rail . This guide goes over the best Saber LC options to help players better understand what to go for when building this character.

Best Saber Light Cones in HSR

As a direct damage dealer who relies on spamming their Ultimate, Saber benefits from anything that bumps up her raw offensive stats . She doesn't need Break Effect like Firefly, nor does she really need any sort of self-healing that characters like Jingliu, Blade, or Clara do. This means we can focus strictly on boosting her ATK and CRIT while leaving everything else to be provided by her teammates.

Under the Blue Sky

Base Stats

952 Base HP

476 ATK

330 DEF

Effect (S5)

Increases the wearer's ATK by 32%. When the wearer defeats an enemy, the wearer's CRIT Rate increases by 24% for 3 turn(s).

This is a standard 4-star Light Cone that players can get by rolling in any HSR banner. It provides a solid ATK boost, and when Saber defeats an enemy, it increases her CRIT Rate by up to 24%. This is great if you lack CRIT Rate from Saber's Relics, but since the latter part of the Light Cone's effect requires you to defeat an enemy, it won't be as good when fighting lone targets.

A Trail of Bygone Blood

Base Stats

1058 HP

529 ATK

331 DEF

Effect (S5)

Increases the wearer's CRIT Rate by 20%. The Skill DMG and Ultimate DMG dealt by the wearer increases by 40%.

This Light Cone is obtainable from the battle pass, and it might just be the best 4-star option for Saber . The added CRIT Rate takes some of the edge off when it comes to Relic farming in HSR , and the added Skill and Ultimate DMG bonuses are more than welcome. When using this, it may be a good idea to have a support unit who can buff Saber's ATK just to compensate for any potential damage loss.

On the Fall of an Aeon

Base Stats

1058 HP

529 ATK

396 DEF

Effect (S5)

When the wearer attacks, increases their ATK by 16% in this battle. This effect can stack up to 4 times. After the wearer breaks an enemy's Weakness, increases DMG dealt by 24%, lasting for 2 turns.

On the Fall of an Aeon is a universally useful Light Cone for any Destruction character in HSR . It offers a solid damage boost that only gets better when its user breaks an enemy's Weakness. The latter shouldn't be a problem for Saber if you're using her against Wind-weak enemies, but if you have Silver Wolf or Anaxa on your team, you should have no problem breaking anyone's Weakness.

A Thankless Coronation

Base Stats

952 HP

582 ATK

529 DEF

Effect (S5)

Increases the wearer's CRIT DMG by 72%. When using Ultimate, increases the wearer's ATK by 80%, and if wearer's Max Energy is greater than or equal to 300, regenerates a fixed amount of Energy equal to 10% of the wearer's Max Energy and increases the wearer's ATK by another 80%, lasting for 2 turns.

A Thankless Coronation is Saber's signature Light Cone, and, as one would expect, it's the absolute best one for her to use. It's curated to fit Saber's playstyle, and no other Light Cone in the game so far will be able to match the sheer value this one can provide for her.

Honkai: Star Rail

9.4 /10

item.title: All Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3+4 Cheats and Game Mods
item.description:
Cheats have always played an important role in the Tony Hawk's Pro Skater franchise, and this is once again the case in Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3+4 . In the 2025 remake, though, they're called game mods, and most of them are unlocked by default.

Players will be able to activate Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3+4 cheats via the game mods section of the options menu. There are two types of game mods available, with assists affecting the way that the game plays and fun game mods altering the way that it looks.

All THPS 3+4 Cheats and Game Mods

Assists

Game Mod

Effect

Perfect Rail Balance

Balance is always perfect while grinding rails.

Perfect Manual Balance

Balance is always perfect while performing manuals.

Perfect Lip Balance

Balance is always perfect while performing lip tricks.

Perfect Skitch Balance

Balance is always perfect while skitching.

Always Special

The Special meter is always full.

No Bails

Players are unable to bail.

Instant Quick Recovery

Players will get up right away after bailing.

Game Speed

Speeds up or slows down gameplay (Half Speed, x1.5 Speed, Double Speed, or Triple Speed).

Timer Length

Extends the length of a session in career mode (5 Minutes, 10 Minutes, or 60 Minutes).

Double Base Score

Doubles the base score of every trick.

Stats

Makes stats more realistic or even more exaggerated (Expert or Super Stats).

The Stats game mod will need to be purchased from the Secret Store for 5,000 Skater Bucks once players have completed all of the goals and pro goals for every THPS 3+4 stage.

Fun

Game Mod

Effect

Unlock Method

Skater Size

Changes the size of the player's skater (Tiny Skater or Giant Skater).

Players will be able to buy the Skater Size game mod from the Secret Store for 10,000 Skater Bucks after completing every goal and pro goal for all nineteen stages.

Trail

Players leave a trail behind them as they skate (Cube FX, Confetti FX, Neon FX, Electric FX, Energy FX, Flame FX, Heart FX, Rainbow FX, Smoke FX, or Sparkler FX).

Players will be able to buy new trails from the Secret Store for 2,000 Skater Bucks after collecting Iron Galaxy Tokens and completing certain goals.

Process FX

Applies a filter to the screen during skating sessions (Chromatic Aberration, 80's Camera, Cel Shade, Edge 2 Color, Fake Fog, Fake Smog, Night Vision, Old Film, Over Sharpen, Pizel, Sketch Texture Color, Toon Flat, Toon White, Underwater, or Video Tape).

Players will be able to buy new process effects from the Secret Store for 1,000 Skater Bucks after collecting Iron Galaxy Tokens and completing certain goals.

Will Using THPS 3+4 Cheats Affect Trophies and Achievements?

Yes. Using assist modes will make it impossible to unlock certain Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3+4 trophies and achievements. Specifically, players will need to unlock the Extra Ball and Unprecedented achievements with assist mods disabled. They also won't be able to use assist mods when completing the game's expert challenges or when attempting speedruns. Just as one might expect, THPS 3+4 cheats cannot be used while playing online.

6 Images
6 Images

item.title: Best Archer Light Cones In Honkai Star Rail
item.description:
Archer

Quantum

Hunt

5-Star

Guides

Build Guide

Level-Up Materials (coming soon)

Team Composition

Best Light Cone

Back to All Characters

Hunt characters in Honkai: Star Rail have a lot of Light Cones that increase their Crit value because most of their kits solely focus on dealing DMG. That makes building them easier since all they need is Crit and ATK%, and they’re ready to go. However, some characters, like Archer, have mechanics that can take advantage of some Light Cones more than others. For that, here are the best Light Cones for Archer in HSR .

8 Only Silence Remains

Base Stats

  • 952 Base HP
  • 476 Base ATK
  • 330 Base DEF

S5 Effect

Increases the wearer's ATK by 32%. If there are 2 or fewer enemies on the field, increases wearer's Crit Rate by 24%.

Archer is a character that scales with ATK% and gets a lot of Crit DMG from his Trace passive. For that, giving him a Light Cone like Only Silence Remains that increase his ATK% and Crit Rate is beneficial to his gameplay. With more ATK%, Archer deals more DMG, while with more Crit Rate, Archer is guaranteed to take advantage of all the Crit DMG he builds up from his kit and his team in HSR .

7 Final Victor

Base Stats

  • 952 Base HP
  • 476 Base ATK
  • 330 Base DEF

S5 Effect

Increases the wearer's ATK by 20%. When the wearer lands a Crit hit on enemies, gains 1 stack of Good Fortune. This can stack up to 4 time(s). Every stack of Good Fortune increases the wearer's Crit DMG by 12%. Good Fortune will be removed at the end of the wearer's turn.

Final Victor is also a decent 4-star Light Cone for Archer since it grants him ATK% and Crit DMG from its passive effect. He needs a lot of Crit Rate to ensure he quickly builds up the Good Fortune stacks, which will notably increase his Crit DMG, especially on S5. Another Light Cone that needs building up and is good for Archer is Swordplay , which increases DMG if Archer keeps hitting the same enemy; an easy feat for Archer, as he can cast his Skill multiple times in a turn.

6 See You at the End

Base Stats

  • 952 Base HP
  • 529 Base ATK
  • 330 Base DEF

S1/S5 Effect

Increases the wearer's Crit DMG by 24/40%. The Skill DMG and Follow-up ATK DMG dealt by the wearer increases by 24/40%.

While it’s a 4-star Light cone, See You at the End is not an F2P option for Archer, given it's a BP weapon. Still, See You at the End is one of the best 4-star Light Cones for Archer since it grants him the Crit DMG he needs, in addition to a lot of extra DMG on his Skill, which is the main source of DPS in Archer’s kit.

5 Baptism of Pure Thought

Base Stats

  • 952 Base HP
  • 582 Base ATK
  • 529 Base DEF

Effect

Increases the wearer's Crit DMG by 20%. For every debuff on the enemy target, the wearer's Crit DMG dealt against this target additionally increases by 8%, stacking up to 3 times. When using Ultimate to attack the enemy target, the wearer receives the Disputation effect, which increases DMG dealt by 36% and enables their follow-up attacks to ignore 24% of the target's DEF. This effect lasts for 2 turns.

Getting into the 5-star options, Archer can use the Baptism of Pure Thought effectively if he has a Nihility unit in the team, like Silver Wolf. Ensuring Archer’s target is debuffed enough to maximize the Light Cone’s requirement will allow Archer to deal more DMG, especially with his Follow-up attacks. It’s not an ideal Light Cone for Archer, but the Crit DMG buffs make it an acceptable choice.

4 Worrisome, Blissful

Base Stats

  • 952 Base HP
  • 476 Base ATK
  • 330 Base DEF

Effect

Increase the wearer's Crit Rate by 18% and increases DMG dealt by follow-up attack by 30%. After the wearer uses a follow-up attack, inflicts the target with the Tame state, stacking up to 2 time(s). When allies hit enemy targets under the Tame state, each Tame stack increases the Crit DMG dealt by 12%.

Worrisome, Blissful starts by granting Archer an 18% Crit Rate, which solves his Crit Rate need and allows players to stack as much Crit DMG as possible on him. Additionally, Archer’s gameplay revolves around using Follow-up attacks to generate Skill Points and deal DMG. That’s perfect for Worrisome, Blissful, as it can increase his Follow-up attacks DMG and debuff enemies to further increase his Crit DMG against them.

3 Cruising in the Stellar Sea

Base Stats

  • 952 Base HP
  • 529 Base ATK
  • 463 Base DEF

S5 Effect

Increases the wearer's Crit Rate by 16%, and increases their Crit Rate against enemies with HP less than or equal to 50% by an extra 16%. When the wearer defeats an enemy, their ATK is increased by 40% for 2 turn(s).

Cruising in the Stellar Sea is an F2P Light Cones for Archer in Honkai: Star Rail . It gives him a decent Base stats alongside Crit Rate and the ability to significantly increase Archer’s ATK% when he defeats an enemy. All this puts Cruising in the Stellar Sea among the best Light Cones for Archer in HSR , even if it’s an F2P option.

2 In the Night

Base Stats

  • 1058 Base HP
  • 582 Base ATK
  • 463 Base DEF

Effect

Increases the wearer's Crit Rate by 18%. While the wearer is in battle, for every 10 SPD that exceeds 100, increases DMG dealt by Basic ATK and Skill by 6%. At the same time, increases the Crit DMG of Ultimate by 12%. This effect can stack up to 6 time(s).

As a Hunt unit, Archer depends on SPD to get their action more frequently, especially if he has the Firmament Frontline: Glamoth set. This Planar Ornaments set increases Archer’s ATK% and DMG if he reaches 160 SPD. Players can pair it with the In the Night Light Cone to further increase Archer’s DMG based on his SPD. All that makes In the Night one of the best 5-star Light Cones for Archer in HSR .

1 The Hell Where Ideals Burn

Base Stats

  • 953 Base HP
  • 582 Base ATK
  • 529 Base DEF

Effect

Increases the wearer's Crit Rate by 16%. When entering combat, if the allies' Skill Points limit is 6 or higher, increases the wearer's ATK by 40%. After each use of the wearer's Skill, increases the wearer's ATK by 10%, stacking up to 4 time(s).

The Hell Where Ideals Burn is Archer’s Signature Light Cone in HSR . It’s his best-in-slot because it gives him exactly what his top-tier Light Cones give, but much better.

The Hell Where Ideals Burn grants Archer a 16% Crit Rate, comparable to other 5-star Light Cones. However, when it comes to the ATK% buff, The Hell Where Ideals Burn increases Archer’s ATK% by a whopping 80%. The first 40% is because he increases the team’s maximum Skill Points limit, and another 40% Archer gets slowly as he keeps casting his Skill. If players want Archer to operate at his best during combat, then they should go for Archer’s best Light Cone in Honkai: Star Rail , The Hell Where Ideals Burn.

item.title: 8 Best RPGs Where Players Don't Need To Think Too Much, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Some RPGs offer a relaxing and enjoyable experience without intense challenges, catering to casual players.
  • Games like Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot and The Outer Worlds are examples of simpler RPGs with laid-back gameplay.
  • Titles like Nox and Stardew Valley provide unique storytelling and a cozy gameplay experience for players.

Some gamers shy away from RPGs, reluctant to get into the genre because of what they feel is a major time sink that demands a lot of their time and attention. This isn't necessarily an incorrect statement, but it's an overgeneralization that doesn't do justice to some of the simpler and easier games in the genre.

Some role-playing games let players relax as they slowly master the mechanics and take part in epic confrontations. The gameplay is not so challenging that players will hit a brick wall, and progression happens at a laid-back pace and helps players relax with these relatively simple RPGs.

8 Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot

A Surprisingly Easy RPG That Lacks Challenge

Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot
8.3 /10
Released
January 16, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Mild Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Fans were hyped to play Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot , which allowed players to power through the entire story of the series in record time. While hardcore gamers didn't like how easy the game was, this sentiment didn't apply to everyone. Many Dragon Ball Z fans appreciated how faithful this game was without pushing them too hard. The fights could be a bit mindless at times, but fans didn't mind a game that made them feel epic. Villainous enemies were the only foes that could give the heroes a hard time.

7 Nox

A Simple ARPG Where Every Class Boasts A Unique Story

Nox
Action RPG
Systems
Released
February 16, 2000

Powered by

Nox is one of the most underrated ARPGs players can get their hands on. The Warrior, Conjurer, and Mage all have different campaigns, making for a unique storytelling approach that encourages players to go through the game multiple times. It helps that the game isn't too hard and let players carve their own path to a goal without facing too many obstructions. Death wasn't too penalizing, and players could get as strong as they needed just by going through the game's dungeons and walloping enemies.

6 The Outer Worlds

A Short, Simple RPG

6 Images
6 Images
The Outer Worlds
9 /10
17
8.3 /10
Released
October 25, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

Fans were disappointed that The Outer Worlds wasn't sci-fi Fallout: New Vegas , but this doesn't mean that the experience isn't worth investing a few hours in. Players who like funny writing and laid-back gameplay will get a kick out of this game. The worldbuilding isn't too complex, and combat can become ridiculously easy after a point. This isn't necessarily a bad thing, since players don't have to invest too much time learning how the game works.

5 Final Fantasy

The First Game In This Legendary Series Follows A Simple Formula

6 Images
6 Images
Final Fantasy (1987)
8.5 /10
Released
December 18, 1987

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

One of the most legendary JRPG franchises had to start from somewhere, with 1987's Final Fantasy marking a major turning point for the genre. It set the groundwork for something special, although the original release was extremely challenging.

The same can't be said for the re-releases, which are way easier in comparison and are nowhere near as complicated as the rest of the series. The re-released versions make for a simple and engaging experience. Players choose a job at the start of the game for each Warrior of Light, reaching new heights as heroes in a fairly straightforward story.

4 Fallout 4

Bethesda Made Made The Franchise More Palatable For The Masses

Fallout 4
9 /10
47
8.8 /10
Released
November 10, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M FOR MATURE: BLOOD AND GORE, INTENSE VIOLENCE, STRONG LANGUAGE, USE OF DRUGS
Powered by

Fallout 4 is a perfect game for players who don't want to engage with complicated gameplay loops present in most RPGs. Bethesda made several changes to simplify the RPG formula from previous games. This didn't sit right with hardcore fans, who felt it had been dumbed down. However, the same can't be said for casual players who could enjoy the game's magical exploration without feeling overwhelmed by other mechanics. The perk system made progression easier to manage, and the combat became way more manageable over time.

3 South Park: The Stick Of Truth

Easy Combat That Features Real-Time Elements

South Park: The Stick of Truth
8 /10
7.4 /10
Released
March 4, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Drug Reference, Mature Humor, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Violence
Powered by

Players loved South Park: The Stick of Truth for feeling like a chapter straight out of the show, with the writing and art style to match. It was a genuine achievement and let fans enjoy one of the funniest RPGs that didn't opt for an ultra-challenging combat system.

This meant that casual players could get into the title without facing too many problems, which was perfect for a game appealing to fans of the TV show. With trademark South Park humor and approachable gameplay, Stick of Truth stands out as an example of what a video game adaptation of an existing IP should achieve.

2 Stardew Valley

A Relaxing, Cozy RPG With A Focus On Farming

Stardew Valley
74
9.2 /10
Released
February 26, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E for Everyone (Fantasy Violence, Mild Blood, Mild Language, Simulated Gambling, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco)
Powered by

One of the most laid-back and relaxing RPGs that fans can check out, Stardew Valley 's premise is as simple as they come. Players inherit a property in a small town with a farm that they must restore and maintain. This is just a small part of what makes Stardew Valley such a special game, with the game featuring everything from social simulation elements to a simple combat loop. None of it is overbearing, which ensures that players can get into this title with ease.

1 The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

Becomes Easy Over Time, Allowing Players To Soak In The Sights

Skyrim
9.3 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes
Powered by

Skyrim is one of the best video games ever made, and there's a reason why this game enjoys such a massive player base. The title can be somewhat challenging at the beginning, but this difficulty fades over time. This means that players who don't want to engage with hardcore mechanics can still get a kick out of playing Skyrim . The learning curve is nowhere near as massive as players think, and will help the aspiring Dragonborn embark on grand adventures of their own with ease.

item.title: Archer Team Composition Guide In Honkai Star Rail
item.description:
Archer

Quantum

Hunt

5-Star

Guides

Build Guide

Level-Up Materials (coming soon)

Team Composition

Best Light Cone

Back to All Characters

Archer is a playable Quantum character in Honkai: Star Rail . As a Hunt unit, Archer needs a lot of attention from his team to succeed, as they provide him with enough buffs and debuffs to be able to deal massive DMG to his target. For that, here are the best team comps for Archer in HSR .

1 Archer + Sparkle + Cipher + Huohuo

As a Quantum DPS who heavily depends on Skill Points, Sparkle is Archer's best support in Honkai: Star Rail . Archer needs to play as much as possible to consume the team’s Skill Points and reset his Follow-up attacks. He also needs Sparkle’s buffs for his DMG, Crit DMG, and ATK%. On top of that, every time Sparkle increases the team’s Skill Points, Archer will get a 120% Crit DMG buff through his Traces.

Next, players can add Cipher to Archer’s teams in HSR . She will automatically make enemies take 40% extra DMG by just existing on the field. Not only that, but Cipher will also record all DMG until it’s time to unleash her Ultimate, which can deal an insane amount of DMG to a single target. Players can also replace Cipher with Silver Wolf , who got a buff to her kit in version 3.4, to debuff enemies.

Finally, in an Archer team, it’s important to add a character like Huohuo for sustainability. She can buff the team’s DMG and energy, allowing Archer to use his Ultimate more often and deal even more DMG when he spams his Skills.

2 Archer + Sparkle + Sunday + Fu Xuan

Archer is another DPS that pairs perfectly with Sunday in HSR . Sunday provides everything Archer needs, like giving him extra DMG, Crit Rate, Crit DMG, energy, and even more. Sunday constantly recovers the Skill Point he used to cast his Skill, which keeps Archer buffed by his passive, and keeps the team SP positive. He also advances Archer’s Action by 100%, which helps Archer play more often with all these buffs from Sunday and Sparkle .

Both Harmony units in HSR greatly increase Archer’s DPS as they keep the team SP positive. However, adding Sunday to Archer’s team removes one Quantum unit from the team, slightly reducing Sparkle’s buff. Players can easily fix that by adding Quantum supports like Fu Xuan and Lynx .

3 Archer + Hanya + Pela + Gallagher

Although not the most optimal, players can still play Archer with an F2P team. Pair him with Hanya , who will slightly buff his DMG while generating Skill Points. Players can replace her with Bronya if she has her Light Cone or her first Eidolon. Both have mechanics to help Bronya regenerate Skill Points for the team and keep her on the SP positive side.

Pela is another SP-positive character who can help Archer in his F2P team. She specializes in shredding enemies’ DEF with her Ultimate, which allows her to create Skill Points on her turn (although you still want to use her Skill occasionally to get her Ultimate faster). It won't trigger Archer’s Crit DMG passive, but it will help him launch more arrows at enemies during his Skill spam. Similarly, Gallagher can restore the team’s Skill Points with his extra turns while providing enough healing to keep the team alive during combat.
